pravindra commented on issue #4717: ARROW-4301: [Java] use arrow-jni profile for both gandiva/orc
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4717#issuecomment-506642207
 
 
   @kou The command that you sent worked for orc, but not gandiva.
   
   Did you by any chance change the cmd to ?
   
   mvn \
        release:prepare \
       -Dtag=${tag} \
       -DreleaseVersion=${version} \
       -DautoVersionSubmodules \
       -DdevelopmentVersion=${next_version_snapshot} \
       -Darrow.cpp.build.dir=${cpp_build_dir}**/release** \
       -P ${profile}

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: See https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/a486db8c1476be1165981c4fe22996639da8e550. This is breaking the build so I'm going to patch manually
fields.summary: [Java][Gandiva] Maven snapshot version update does not seem to update Gandiva submodule

comments.body: [~pravindra] can you look into this? This was an issue with the 0.12 release, see the linked PR

[~wesmckinn] [~kszucs] [~Pindikura Ravindra]This seems to work as expected for me.

I ran mvn versions:set -DnewVersion=0.14 from java root and it flipped the gandiva's parent version too in the pom.

Note : You will not see Gandiva in the reactor order but that should be ok.

Alternatively you can use mvn -P gandiva versions:set -DnewVersion=0.14, to also see Gandiva in the reactor order.

Please let me know if i misunderstood the issue (or) there is some weird build order in my box locally because i build with Gandiva profile regularly.
I am going ahead and resolving this. Please re-open if the issue persists.
Well, I guess we'll see if this breaks again in the 0.13 release

Reopening, this did not work for the 0.13 release either

https://github.com/apache/arrow/tree/apache-arrow-0.13.0/java

https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/dfb9e7af3cd92722893a3819b6676dfdef08f896
[~kou] FYI -- master build will be broken after you rebase once the release vote closes. See https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3435 for the past fix

Thanks for the information.
I've applied a fix by https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4087 manually.
We should fix this until 0.14.0.

[~kou] [~wesmckinn] Could you please share the sequence of commands that is used in the release process to upgrade the version?

Alternatively please point me to any document that outlines the same.

The following command lines will reproduce this case:

{noformat}
git tag -d apache-arrow-0.14.0
git branch -D maven-test
git checkout -b maven-test
cd java
mvn release:clean
mvn release:prepare -Dtag=apache-arrow-0.14.0 -DreleaseVersion=0.14.0 -DautoVersionSubmodules -DdevelopmentVersion=0.15.0-SNAPSHOT
{noformat}

({{mvm}} command lines are extracted from {{dev/release/00-prepare.sh}} for easy to try.)
[~pravindra] any ideas about this? This will get us again in 0.14 if it is not fixed
[~wesmckinn] sorry for delay in getting back on this, i will look into this in the weekend.

[~wesmckinn] i guess the problem is that Gandiva is not part of the default maven profile, to include Gandiva we would need run maven using Gandiva profile like the following

mvn release:prepare -Dtag=apache-arrow-0.14.0 -DreleaseVersion=0.14.0 -DautoVersionSubmodules -DdevelopmentVersion=0.15.0-SNAPSHOT -p gandiva

Please note the profile added at the end.

I could not run the commands [~kou] mentioned since i do not have the gpg keys setup but my guess is that it should work.

Also note that you will have the same issue for the new ORC adapter being introduced for doing ORC reads natively.
I made this a blocker for the release
[~praveenbingo] is there a problem with adding Gandiva to the default Maven profile? We're getting close to the release so we need a pull request to fix this issue
Bumping this up again. If we have to let this be broken again for 0.14.0 it is not the end of the world but it would be nice to fix it

[~wesmckinn] - gandiva java has a dependency on cpp. so, adding gandiva to the default profile will mean that the arrow java cannot be built as standalone (it can be done right now for users who don't require gandiva).
